item.title: item_analysis 0506
item.description: Data Scoring Extract responses only Item analysis Difficulty and Discrimination Score transformation library(CTT) library(psychometric) library(tidyverse) Data key <- read_csv("107ctt_key.csv", col_names = T) ## ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## cols( ## quiz_no = col_character(), ## key = col_character() ## ) dat <- read_csv('107ctt_dat.csv') ## ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## cols( ## .default = col_character(), ## player = col_double() ## ) ## ℹ Use `spec()` for the full column specifications.

item.title: 0413 bayesien meta-analysis
item.description: #install.packages("gemtc") #install.packages("netmeta") #install.packages("rjags") library(gemtc) ## Loading required package: coda library(netmeta) ## Loading required package: meta ## Loading 'meta' package (version 4.16-1). ## Type 'help(meta)' for a brief overview. ## ## Attaching package: 'meta' ## The following object is masked from 'package:gemtc': ## ## forest ## Loading 'netmeta' package (version 1.3-0). ## Type 'help("netmeta-package")' for a brief overview. library(rjags) ## Linked to JAGS 4.3.0 ## Loaded modules: basemod,bugs library(rio) library(igraph) ##

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.
